SEARCH
Package edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.service

Class PatternRepository

java.lang.Object
edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.service.PatternRepository
@Singleton public class PatternRepository extends Object
Provides high-level operations on a repository of Pattern instances, backed by a SQLite database, in turn accessed via SereknittyDatabase. This class has no mutable state, and its methods are thread-safe; however, mutating operations (involving INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE on the underlying database) attempted simultaneously could block or fail.

  • Method Details

    • getPattern

      public LiveData<PatternWithRows> getPattern(long id)
      Returns a LiveData-based query for the Pattern entity instance identified by id. The query executes when observed, or (if already being observed) whenever the contents of the underlying user table are modified using Room data-access methods.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier (primary key value) of a Pattern entity instance.
      Returns:
      LiveData-based query for the Pattern identified by id.

    • getAllPatterns

      public LiveData<List<Pattern>> getAllPatterns()
      Returns a LiveData-based query of all Pattern entity instances. The query executes when observed, or (if already being observed) whenever the contents of the underlying pattern table are modified using Room data-access methods.

    • save

      public Single<Pattern> save(Pattern pattern)
      Constructs and returns a Single task that, when executed (subscribed to), will insert or update the specified pattern in the database, and pass the updated Pattern instance to the subscribing Consumer. The specific persistence operation is determined by examining the value returned by Pattern.getId(): a value of zero (0) indicates the user has not yet been INSERTed and must be; a non-zero value indicates that user is already in the database, and must thus be UPDATEd.
      Parameters:
      pattern - Instance of Pattern entity class to be persisted (inserted or updated) in the database.
      Returns:
      Single task that will persist pattern to the database when executed (subscribed to).

    • save

      public Single<Row> save(Row row)
      Constructs and returns a Single task that, when executed (subscribed to), will insert or update the specified row in the database, and pass the updated Row instance to the subscribing Consumer. The specific persistence operation is determined by examining the value returned by Row.getId(): a value of zero (0) indicates the row has not yet been INSERTed and must be; a non-zero value indicates that row is already in the database, and must thus be UPDATEd.
      Parameters:
      row - The row that is to be saved.
      Returns:
      Single that indicates the result of the save.

    • save

      public Single<RowStitch> save(RowStitch stitch)
      Constructs and returns a Single task that, when executed (subscribed to), will insert or update the specified stitch in the database, and pass the updated RowStitch instance to the subscribing Consumer. The specific persistence operation is determined by examining the value returned by RowStitch.getId(): a value of zero (0) indicates the stitch has not yet been INSERTed and must be; a non-zero value indicates that stitch is already in the database, and must thus be UPDATEd.
      Parameters:
      stitch - The rowStitch that is to be saved.
      Returns:
      Single that indicates the result of the save.

    • save

      public Single<Collection<RowStitch>> save(Collection<RowStitch> stitches)
      Constructs and returns a Single task that, when executed (subscribed to), will insert or update the specified stitches in the database, and pass the updated RowStitch instance to the subscribing Consumer. The specific persistence operation is determined by examining the value returned by RowStitch.getId(): a value of zero (0) indicates the stitches have not yet been INSERTed and must be; a non-zero value indicates that stitches are already in the database, and must thus be UPDATEd.
      Parameters:
      stitches - The stitches to be saved.
      Returns:
      Single that indicates the result of the save.
